info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 6:46PM EST until January 09 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Union County in piedmont North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 PM EST, Rain gauges reported rainfall totals of 2 to 3 inches in the past 12 hours. Runoff from this heavy rain, and from upstream areas will allow minor flooding to continue through late evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroe, South Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Wingate, Waxhaw, Marshville, Lake Park, Mineral Springs, Hemby Bridge, Marvin, Fairview In Union County, Sturdivants, Jaars and Trinity. - Flooding is most likely along Goose Creek at Mill Grove Road northeast of Indian Trail, which will impact several roadways from Unionville to Indian Trail. Flooding will also continue along Bearskin Creek near Monroe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
